intro: Bredia scandens, commonly known as the climbing breadfruit, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in catkins. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often used in traditional medicine. Bredia scandens is typically found in tropical rainforests and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
